itemDescription: British soldier, railwayman, clergyman and scholar (1893–1985)

wikipedia_page.main: John Hamilton Maxwell Staniforth (23 June 1893 – 26 December 1985), known to his family as Max, was a British soldier, railwayman, radio presenter, clergyman and scholar.

response: * Maxwell Staniforth, At war with the 16th Irish Division 1914-1918 : the Staniforth letters

In the Introduction to his 1964 translation of Meditations, the Anglican priest Maxwell Staniforth discussed the profound impact of Stoicism on Christianity. Michael Grant called Marcus Aurelius "the noblest of all the men who, by sheer intelligence and force of character, have prized and achieved goodness for its own sake and not for any reward." Gregory Hays' translation of Meditations for The Modern Library made The Washington Posts bestseller list for two weeks in 2002.The Washington Post Bestseller List June 9th, 2002
* Marcus Aurelius, Meditations, translated by Maxwell Staniforth; , or translated by Gregory Hays; . Also Available on wikisource translated by various translators
